TopicTitle: KSR1 - Whatney - Ares Mars Direct Rover - as in The Martian

Articles.Content:
Edit: Let's try that again, now with real stock parts, 100% less on load explosions, almost 50% fewer parts, 100% more science!, 100% more solar power! and Authentic RTG for heating.

Drive across Duna!

All your fellow Kerbals left you for dead on Duna?

Drive across Duna in a Rover towing another Rover, reach the Duna Ascent Vehicle and get home safe.

9t on the pad

24.5m/s top speed

Designed with active Suspension, and modified centre of gravity. It is not untippable but it is very well behaved for such a substantial beast. You have to actually try to tip it. Normal driving is easy. Warranty void if launched.

Hmmm, sorry about that, it seems Ven's Stock Revamp does make a difference, it's not just the same parts with better textures. It seems the stock Rover is a bomb waiting to go off on load. Hang in there I will be back with a new version soon, using really stock parts this time.
Let's try that again, now with real stock parts, 100% less on load explosions, almost 50% fewer parts, 100% more science!, 100% more solar power! and Authentic RTG for heating.
I always imagined the rovers from The Martian as the concept for NASA's Constellation SPR Rovers. Do they show the rovers in the trailer for the movie?

I think so because these look familiar, there are also pictures onlline.
Hey man. Do you have a reference picture?

I loved the book! Also, I thought Watney had a balloon roof for the trailer. The rovers are great though! Good job.

Next make his inflatable bedroom. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

A remark: you mention "100% more science", but there is no scientific experiment on board. The suspension is interesting but IMHO not suitable for long distance ride at 20 m/s (I got nearly immediately explosions).

I would also suggest to activate the steering of more wheels (only the front ones have the steering activated) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

There was no Mobile Processing Lab before, so there is 100% more science now. The suspension is as good as I can get it, I only activate the front wheel steering so the turn is not as sharp and likely to tip the rover. It's top speed is above 20m/s, which is not what you should be doing across rough terrain.

Edit: As an example you can go up and down the runway sides without slowing, but the steep second slope at the end of the runway you will need to slow down.
